Blue Wensleydale: Dating back to shortly after the Norman Conquest this cheese was brought to Wensleydale by the Cistercian monks of Jervauix Abbey from the Roquefort region of France, the famous blue cheese making region. All Wensleydale cheese was blue until the mid 19th century.
Blue Wensleydale is made to an original recipe that makes a unique creamy mellow blue cheese that has a genuine smoothness in texture and taste.
Blue Wensleydale is made from pasteurised milk,
is suitable for vegetarians and is available prepacked as part of the Select range of cheeses at Waitrose.
Uses: Crumble and add to salads or pasta dishes or serve with warm bread and sliced tomatoes for a quick lunch or on a cheeseboard.
To eat: If serving on a cheeseboard remove the cheese from the fridge an hour before serving, to allow it to come to room temperature and to develop its full texture and flavour.
